Articles.Content:
Ive finally come across the world of modular Munar bases, and decided to begin my own, much more massive, modular base/small city! CITY stands for Crater-based Independent Towers of kerbals saying Yay. Each 'city' will be >2km, to prevent lag, and will have some method of transportation (monorail, RCS jet, rover) between them, at a small spaceport at them. DETAILS - Ive been planning for a while, no part mods or mechjeb hyper edit etc. Already have part of base Stage One base built.

Will consist of 3 stages:

Stage One: Basic designs will be created, such as cranes, rovers, modules, ships, etc. and a small test base.

Stage Two: Assembly of Crater Capital begins, a large modular base with a spaceport and refueling station for surrounding cites.

Stage Three: Surrounding City will be constructed

SECRET STAGE FOUR: Will use the amazing clouds and city lights mod, to add city lights, to the area my 'city'.

Overall Status: Stage One - Test Base and Designs

Current Status: Rebuilding on Career mode - 0.24.2

Current Craft:

Mun Test Base 1 (MTB1 - A prototype base for seeing how high and wide you can build)

Large Modular Transport (LMT - A big, crane like thing, for attaching large modules to the sides of things)

Modular Transport (MT - A little rover that picks up smaller modules and also attaches them to the sides of things, like an ant)

Edited July 26, 2014 by Krustaceous Krouton
Status Update

Ive been having problems with the 3m decouplers, making it more difficult to send the larger modules to the Mun. Anyone else having issues/have a solution? By problems I mean crashing.

And also Bump :-P

Yeah the 3m decouplers are buggy. Try this: open the GameData\NASAmission\Parts\Size3Decoupler\part.cfg file delete the following line:

//PhysicsSignificance = 1

Make a backup of the file beforehand just in case.

Hope this helps...

I think it worked, although there is a bit of bugginess still, Its causing the separated stage to spin crazily - Subsequently wrecking the rest of the ship. Just finished downloading 0.24 and hope it fixes those issues. Thanks for the help!
Yeah, the bug I was referring to is supposed to be fixed with 0.24. Wether thats true or not, I can not confirm yet (havent used the 3m decouplers at all yet since the patch).
